references.paper_title: Local causal and Markov blanket induction for causal discovery and feature selection for classification Part I: algorithms and empirical evaluation
references.reason: This paper is foundational to causal discovery and feature selection, providing algorithms and empirical evaluations that are directly relevant to the current work.
This book provides a comprehensive overview of bipartite graphs and their applications, which is relevant to the causal discovery methods used in this paper.

references.paper_title: Partial correlation and conditional correlation as measures of conditional independence
references.reason: This paper introduces the concepts of partial correlation and conditional correlation as measures of conditional independence, which are central to the current work.
This paper is a seminal work on conditional independence in statistical theory, providing a foundational framework for the current work.
This book is a comprehensive overview of causality, which is essential for understanding the causal discovery methods used in this paper.
